description: Borrowed from Late Latin natatorium, noun use of the neuter singular of Latin natātōrius (“for swimming; natatory”).

entries.meaning: (US) A swimming pool, especially an indoor one; a building housing one or more swimming pools.
examples: A sunken chamber almost like a natatorium at some hot-springs resort, so cool and dim that you forgot after a while about the desert waiting out there to resume for you as soon as you stepped back into it.  […]
